docs.lead_paragraph: Although there was no formal announcement, Ken Rosenthal reported that 2016 would be Ortiz’s last season. His status in the game might leave him no choice but to have a farewell tour.

headline.main: A Lost Way, a Lost Year for the Red Sox

docs.lead_paragraph: Mo Vaughn's eye and reputation took a hit when he was involved in a bar scuffle two years ago. Now accused of punching a man at a strip club, the star first baseman of the Boston Red Sox said today that he would do what it takes to prove his innocence. Scott Bird, 24, of North Olmsted, Ohio, said Vaughn punched him in the face while they were in the doorway of Tiffany's Cabaret at 2:30 A.M. Saturday. Charges have not been filed.
docs.abstract: Boston Red Sox star Mo Vaughn disputes Scott Bird's charge that he punched him at Cleveland strip club; holds he was at adjacent club (S)

docs.lead_paragraph: The Boston Red Sox placed outfielder WIL CORDERO on waivers yesterday, a source told The Associated Press. If he is claimed before the deadline Thursday, the Red Sox could pull Cordero back, then work out a trade with the claiming team. If not, Boston could assign the 25-year-old outfielder to the minor leagues, release him or return him to his exile of ''administrative leave.'' Teams do not usually confirm when players are placed on major league waivers, routinely used to gauge trade interest and different from unconditional release waivers used to discard unwanted players.
